Name: Inner Coffin of Thuya
Description: This inner coffin of Thuya is made of wood, gold, and silver is gilded on the outside and silvered on the inside. The necklace is inlaid with glass and the pectoral, a large piece of jewelry worn on the chest, below the wig is composed of a scarab. Nut and Nephthys are depicted kneeling on the "Neb" sign of gold with outspread wings. On the right and left sides we find Thoth, Hapi, Anubis, Qebehsenuef, and Imsety who also take part in the protection of the deceased.
